content:
So, "Struct Expression" currently designates the expression for creating both structs and unions, and soon also enums. I feel like calling it a "struct expression" is a bad fit and it should be renamed. Some bikeshedding names:

  • Named Constructor Expression
  • Named Value Expression
  • User Defined Type Literal Expression
  • Named Literal Expression
Aggregate makes me think of arrays (and, tuples,)
I think that's reasonable. Are you looking to describe all of those, or just struct/union/enum but not array or tuple?
Just those three. The syntax for Name { ... }, Name, and we give a mention to Name( ... ).
Tuples and arrays each have their own expressions currently.

Meh, this is an established terminology that is already used everywhere (?).
It's hard to come up with a better short name for "expressions for braced structs, braced variants, unions and sometimes even non-braced structs and variants" than the name that was adopted naturally.
ADT expressions? But I'm in agreement with Vadim here.
